metadata.title: CVE-2011-5034 apache-geronimo: hash table collisions CPU usage DoS (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: The MITRE CVE dictionary describes this issue as: Apache Geronimo 2.2.1 and earlier computes hash values for form parameters without restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) by sending many crafted parameters.  NOTE: this might overlap CVE-2011-4461. 
            STATEMENT: apache-geronimo is packaged with Red Hat OpenStack Platform 13.0's OpenDaylight (ODL). However because the flaw is moderate, Red Hat will not be releasing a fix for the ODL package at this time.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
opendaylight is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
